thread.title: Danny Dyer spotted back in the UK for first time after EastEnders temporary break
thread.title_full: Danny Dyer spotted back in the UK for first time after EastEnders temporary break

author: Emmeline Saunders
title: Danny Dyer spotted back in the UK for first time after EastEnders temporary break
text:
Danny Dyer spotted back in the UK for first time after EastEnders temporary break The soap star was seen on the streets of Essex with his wife Share Danny Dyer seen for the first time (Photo: XPOSURE.COM) Share   Thank you for subscribing!   
Danny Dyer has been spotted back in the UK for the first time since his temporary break from EastEnders was announced last month. 
The Mick Carter actor was seen striding down an Essex high street with his wife Joanne Mas in tow, having just returned from a trip to South Africa to recuperate. 
He was wearing jeans and a leather jacket and puffed on a cigarette as he did a spot of shopping with his missus. Danny and his wife Jo were seen shopping together (Photo: ISIM JAHA) 
The star had taken a hiatus from filming for the BBC soap following a drunken appearance at the National Television Awards in January. 
"The producers are concerned about him for a number of reasons," a source revealed at the time. 
"It was clear to onlookers he appeared very drunk at the NTAs. It is best that he takes some time out to sort his life out. He appears to be exhausted," they told The Sun. The EastEnders star carried two shopping bags on his trip (Photo: ISIM JAHA) It was the first time he was seen in public since returning from South Africa (Photo: ISIM JAHA) Danny is yet to return to the soap (Photo: ISIM JAHA) 
Danny's break is thought to be for a number of weeks while he looks after himself and gets back to full health. 
But rumours started swirling last week that the Cockney geezer was already back on the EastEnders set, ready to start work again. 
However, an insider exclusively revealed that the reports were untrue. Reports that he was back on set were denied this week (Photo: ISIM JAHA) Danny's wife, Joanne (Photo: ISIM JAHA) 
"Danny is not back on set," said our source. 
"Any claims that he has returned to filming are false." 
It was initially thought that EastEnders' producers could send Danny's character Mick to jail to explain his absence. 
But now that Shirley has been packed off to prison instead, fans are wondering what Mick will do next. 
In Tuesday's episode he was seen crying in bed and on the verge of a nervous breakdown - and producers have been teasing a dramatic climax to all his problems. Mick Carter was seen struggling with his emotions this week (Photo: BBC) 
Meanwhile, it's been revealed that the 'Enders cast are planning a big party for Danny when he eventually returns to the set. 
"They're keen to show everyone is behind him 100 per cent after his tough few months," a source told the Daily Star. 
"They are planning a round of applause when he steps back behind the bar for filming for the first time." Like us on Facebook
